data.scheme_name: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy 2023-28 - Spinning Sector (Cooperative Spinning Mills) - Capital Subsidy - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides government incentives ranging from 30% to 45% to the e new cooperative spinning units.
data.eligibility: All units engaged in Spinning mills activity.
data.conditions:
1. In the case of electricity subsidy for existing units, subsidy will be provided or a period of 2 years only. 
  2. Post the set period of 2 years, no electricity subsidy will be provided. 
  3. However, the subsidy amount of 12 months will be calculated and provided as capital subsidy for establishment of solar power plant. 
  4. The units will be considered for technology upgradation under the MAHA Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme (Maha-TUFS), provided: The unit have completed 15 years of production on the existing machinery. 
  5. The unit has a net positive worth. 
  6. The unit uses clean energy. 
  7. The unit has paid-back/ returned at least 50% of the Government share capital.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in Spinning mills activity.
data.prerequisites:
1. In the case of electricity subsidy for existing units, subsidy will be provided or a period of 2 years only. 
  2. Post the set period of 2 years, no electricity subsidy will be provided. 
  3. However, the subsidy amount of 12 months will be calculated and provided as capital subsidy for establishment of solar power plant. 
  4. The units will be considered for technology upgradation under the MAHA Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme (Maha-TUFS), provided: The unit have completed 15 years of production on the existing machinery. 
  5. The unit has a net positive worth. 
  6. The unit uses clean energy. 
  7. The unit has paid-back/ returned at least 50% of the Government share capital.
data.context:
• Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy of the State is in line with the 5F vision of the Government of India- Farm to Fiber to Factory to Fashion to Foreign. 
  • The policy envisions integrating the whole textile value chain and create an enabling environment for sustained growth of all sub-sectors in the industry.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the sector and encourage units in various parts of the State.
data.description:
1. Scheme provides government incentives based on following zones: 
    • Zone 1 : 45% government equity and 50% loan from FI 
    • Zone 2 : 40% government equity and 50% loan from FI 
    • Zone 3 : 35% government equity and 50% loan from FI 
    • Zone 4 : 30% government equity and 50% loan from FI 
  2. Capital Investment Subsidy under MAHA-TUFS : 
    • Zone 1 : 40% of cost of eligible machinery or Rs. 2500 lakhs, whichever is less 
    • Zone 2 : 35% of cost of eligible machinery or Rs. 2000 lakhs, whichever is less 
    • Zone 3 : 30% of cost of eligible machinery or Rs. 1500 lakhs, whichever is less 
    • Zone 4 : 25% of cost of eligible machinery or Rs. 1000 lakhs, whichever is less
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the Maharashtra Textile Department : https://etextile.maharashtra.gov.in/registration
data.funding_mechanism:
1. The capital subsidy will be paid after the project comes into production. 
  2. This will be paid in two installments: 
    • 1st instalment: 60% of eligible amount after 12 months. 
    • 2nd instalment: 40% of eligible amount after 24 months.
data.additional_info:
• Zone 1: - Amravati, Akola, Amravati, Buldhana, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Gondia, Nagpur, Washim, Wardha, Yavatmal.
  •  Zone 2: - Aurangabad, Beed, Dhule, Hingoli, Jalgaon, Jalna, Latur, Nanded, Osmanabad, Parbhani.
  •  Zone 3: - Ahmednagar, Nashik, Nandurbar. 
  • Zone 4: - Kolhapur, Mumbai City, Mumbai Suburban, Palaghar, Pune, Ratnagiri, Raigad, Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara, Solapur, Thane.
data.checklist_info_a:
Udyam Registration Certificate 
GST Certificate 
Financials for Last 2 years 
Projected financial data 
Lending Bank Details 
Basic KYC Documents
Detailed Project Report (DPR)
data.checklist_info_d:
Address : Government of Maharashtra, Co-operation, Marketing and Textile Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai 400032
Email : textilepolicy-mah[At]gov[Dot]in
Phone No..: 022-22026805
data.beneficiary: Manufacturing textile industry - Co-operative - Maharashtra - All MSMEs
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
